\section{Learning target DF3, version 4} % checkit 15
\providecommand{\stxKnowl}{}\renewcommand{\stxKnowl}[1]{#1  \vfill}
\providecommand{\stxOuttro}{}\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxTitle}{}\renewcommand{\stxTitle}[1]{#1}
% Comment next line to show outtros
\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{}
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

Demonstrate and explain how to find the derivative of the following functions. Be sure to write down which derivative rules (constant multiple, sum / difference, etc.) you are using in your work.

\begin{enumerate}
\item
\stxKnowl{
 \(g(t) = -5 \, t^{4} - 9 \, t^{3} - 6 \, t^{2} - 6\)

\stxOuttro{
 \(g'(t) = -20 \, t^{3} - 27 \, t^{2} - 12 \, t\) 

}
}

\item
\stxKnowl{
 \(f(w) = \sqrt[3]{w^5} + \frac{4}{w^{5}}\)

\stxOuttro{
 \(f'(w) = \frac{5}{3} \, w^{\frac{2}{3}} - \frac{20}{w^{6}}\) 

}
}

\item
\stxKnowl{
 \(h(y) = 2 \, e^{y} + 2 \, \sin\left(y\right)\)

\stxOuttro{
 \(h'(y) = 2 \, \cos\left(y\right) + 2 \, e^{y}\) 

}
}

\end{enumerate}

%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

\section{Learning target DF4, version 4} % checkit 15
\providecommand{\stxKnowl}{}\renewcommand{\stxKnowl}[1]{#1 \vfill}
\providecommand{\stxOuttro}{}\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxTitle}{}\renewcommand{\stxTitle}[1]{#1}
% Comment next line to show outtros
\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{}
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

Demonstrate and explain how to find the derivative of the following functions. Be sure to write down which derivative rules (product, quotient, sum and difference, etc.) you are using.

\begin{enumerate}
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(\renewcommand{\log}{\ln} f(x)= -{\left(3 \, x^{2} - 6 \, x + 2\right)} \cos\left(x\right)\)

\stxOuttro{
\(\renewcommand{\log}{\ln} f' (x)= -6 \, {\left(x - 1\right)} \cos\left(x\right) + {\left(3 \, x^{2} - 6 \, x + 2\right)} \sin\left(x\right)\)

}
}

\item
\stxKnowl{
\(\renewcommand{\log}{\ln} h(y)= \frac{3 \, y^{2} - 3 \, y - 2}{\sin\left(y\right)}\)

\stxOuttro{
\(\renewcommand{\log}{\ln} h' (y)= \frac{{\left(3 \, y^{2} - 3 \, y - 2\right)} \cos\left(y\right)}{\sin\left(y\right)^{2}} - \frac{3 \, {\left(2 \, y - 1\right)}}{\sin\left(y\right)}\)

}
}

\item
\stxKnowl{
\(\renewcommand{\log}{\ln} g(w)= \frac{2 \, w^{2} - w + 4}{w^{\frac{1}{6}}}\)

\stxOuttro{
\(\renewcommand{\log}{\ln} g' (w)= \frac{22 \, w^{2} - 5 \, w - 4}{6 \, w^{\frac{7}{6}}}\)

}
}

\end{enumerate}


%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
\pagebreak
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

\section{Learning target DF5, version 4} % checkit 15
\providecommand{\stxKnowl}{}\renewcommand{\stxKnowl}[1]{#1 \vfill}
\providecommand{\stxOuttro}{}\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxTitle}{}\renewcommand{\stxTitle}[1]{#1}
% Comment next line to show outtros
\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{}
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

Demonstrate and explain how to find the derivative of the following functions. Be sure to write down which derivative rules (constant multiple, sum, chain, etc.) you are using.

 Demonstrate and explain how to find the derivative of the following functions. Be sure to explicitly denote which derivative rules (product, quotient, sum and difference, etc.) you are using in your work. 

\begin{enumerate}
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(g(t)= 3 \, \cos\left(-3 \, t^{2} - 3 \, t + 4\right)\)

\stxOuttro{
\(g' (t)= 9 \, {\left(2 \, t + 1\right)} \sin\left(-3 \, t^{2} - 3 \, t + 4\right)\)

}
}

\item
\stxKnowl{
\(h(y)= 5 \, \sin\left(y^{7/2}\right)\)

\stxOuttro{
\(h' (y)= \frac{35}{2} \, y^{\frac{5}{2}} \cos\left(y^{\frac{7}{2}}\right)\)

}
}

\item
\stxKnowl{
\(k(w)= 5 \, \Big(\sin\left(w\right)\Big)^{7/2}\)

\stxOuttro{
\(k' (w)= \frac{35}{2} \, \cos\left(w\right) \sin\left(w\right)^{\frac{5}{2}}\)

}
}

\item
\stxKnowl{
\(f(x)= -{\left(5 \, x + 3 \, e^{x} - 4\right)}^{5}\)

\stxOuttro{
\(f' (x)= -5 \, {\left(5 \, x + 3 \, e^{x} - 4\right)}^{4} {\left(3 \, e^{x} + 5\right)}\)

}
}

\end{enumerate}

\section{Learning target DF6, version 4} % checkit 15
\providecommand{\stxKnowl}{}\renewcommand{\stxKnowl}[1]{#1 \vfill}
\providecommand{\stxOuttro}{}\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxTitle}{}\renewcommand{\stxTitle}[1]{#1}
% Comment next line to show outtros
\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{}
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

Demonstrate and explain how to find the derivative of the following functions. Be sure to write down which derivative rules (constant multiple, chain, sum and difference, etc.) you are using.

\begin{enumerate}
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(h(t) = \sqrt{\cos\left(-4 \, t^{3} - t\right)}\)

\stxOuttro{
\(h ' (t) = \frac{{\left(12 \, t^{2} + 1\right)} \sin\left(-4 \, t^{3} - t\right)}{2 \, \sqrt{\cos\left(-4 \, t^{3} - t\right)}}\)

}
}

\item
\stxKnowl{
\(g(w) = {\left(5 \, w^{3} + 7 \, w^{2}\right)}^{3} \cdot \sqrt{w}\)

\stxOuttro{
\(g ' (w) = 3 \, {\left(5 \, w^{3} + 7 \, w^{2}\right)}^{2} {\left(15 \, w^{2} + 14 \, w\right)} \sqrt{w} + \frac{{\left(5 \, w^{3} + 7 \, w^{2}\right)}^{3}}{2 \, \sqrt{w}}\)

}
}

\item
\stxKnowl{
\(f(y) = \left(\frac{y^{2} - 5}{3 \, y^{3} + 4} \right)^{ 5 }\)

\stxOuttro{
\(f ' (y) = 5 \left( -\frac{y^{2} - 5}{3 \, y^{3} + 4} \right)^{ 4 } \left( \frac{9 \, {\left(y^{2} - 5\right)} y^{2}}{{\left(3 \, y^{3} + 4\right)}^{2}} - \frac{2 \, y}{3 \, y^{3} + 4} \right)\)

}
}

\end{enumerate}


%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

\section{Learning target DF7, version 4} % checkit 15
\providecommand{\stxKnowl}{}\renewcommand{\stxKnowl}[1]{#1 \vfill}
\providecommand{\stxOuttro}{}\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxTitle}{}\renewcommand{\stxTitle}[1]{#1}
% Comment next line to show outtros
\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{}
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

Use implicit differentiation to find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\), aka \(y'\), for the equations below.
\begin{enumerate}
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(6 \, x^{5} + y^{3} = 8 - 3 \, e^{y}\)

\stxOuttro{
\(\frac{dy}{dx}=-\frac{10 \, x^{4}}{y^{2} + e^{y}}\)

}
}

\item
\stxKnowl{
\(-3 \, \sin\left(x\right) = 5 \, x \cdot \cos\left(y\right)\)

\stxOuttro{
\(\frac{dy}{dx}=\frac{3 \, \cos\left(x\right) + 5 \, \cos\left(y\right)}{5 \, x \sin\left(y\right)}\)

}
}

\end{enumerate}
